While performing a rapid sequence intubation in the operation theatre, a patient was given a standard intravenous dose of muscle relaxant "A". To maintain the muscle relaxation during surgery, another muscle relaxant Vecuronium was given. At the end of the surgery, neostigmine was used to reverse the residual muscle relaxation. However, the patient did not respond and continued to display too much muscle paralysis to permit safe extubation. Drug A was most likely to be?

Patient undergoing surgery was given a muscle relaxant. It produced marked fall in B. P. and increase in airway resistance which were reversed with diphenhydramine. The muscle relaxant was most probably
0ne of the following statements about succinylcholine is true

options.label: A
options.text: It is the drug of choice in non-traumatic rhabdomyolysis

options.label: B
options.text: It has a long duration of action

options.label: C
options.text: It may induce life threatening hyperkalemia

options.label: D
options.text: It is useful in patients with spinal cord injuries with paraplegia

questions.correct_answer: C. It may induce life threatening hyperkalemia

questions.text: Which of the following is a skeletal muscle relaxant that acts as a central a2 adrenergic agonist.
Dantrolene sodium reduces skeletal muscle tone by

options.label: A
options.text: Reducing Ca2+ release from sarcoplasmic reticulum in the muscle fibre

options.label: C
options.text: Inhibiting the generation of muscle action potential

options.label: D
options.text: Reducing acetylcholine release from motor nerve endings

questions.correct_answer: A. Reducing Ca2+ release from sarcoplasmic reticulum in the muscle fibre

options.label: A

options.label: B

questions.correct_answer: A. It can cause rise in BP on rapid I. V. injection

questions.text: Epinephrine added to a solution of lignocaine for a peripheral nerve block will

options.label: D

questions.text: In spinal anesthesia the segmental level of

options.label: A
options.text: Sympathetic block is lower than the sensory block

options.label: B
options.text: Sympathetic, motor and sensory block has the same level

options.label: C
options.text: Motor block is higher than the sensory block

options.label: D
options.text: Sympathetic block is higher than the sensory block

questions.correct_answer: D. Sympathetic block is higher than the sensory block

options.label: A

options.label: A

options.label: C
options.text: It is not absorbed after surface application

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: D. By surface application, it can anaesthetize unbroken skin

Which of the following statements is not true of local anesthetics?

options.label: A
options.text: The local anesthetic binds to its receptor mainly when the Na+ channel is in the resting state

options.label: B
options.text: me local anesthetic approaches its receptor only from the in neuronal face of the Na+ channel

options.label: C
options.text: The local anesthetic is required in the unionized form for penetrating the neuronal membrane

options.label: D
options.text: The local anesthetic combines with its receptor in the ionized cationic form

questions.correct_answer: A. The local anesthetic binds to its receptor mainly when the Na+ channel is in the resting state

questions.text: A patient is having a malignancy and has been suffering from severe pain. Which of the following opioid analgesics can be used as transdermal patch for alleviation of pain in him?

Which of the following drugs is a full agonist at opioid receptors, has excellent oral bioavailability, analgesic equipotency to morphine and a longer duration of action with milder withdrawal symptoms on abrupt discontinuation?

A patient, Tina was anesthetized with halothane and nitrous oxide and tubocurarine was used for skeletal muscle relaxation. She became hypertensive along with marked muscle rigidity and hyperthermia. Lab reports showed that she has developed hyperkalemia and acidosis. This complication was caused by

options.label: A
options.text: Block of autonomic ganglia by tubocurarine

options.label: B
options.text: Excessive release of calcium from the sarcoplasmic reticulum

options.label: C
options.text: Activation of brain dopamine receptors by halothane

questions.correct_answer: B. Excessive release of calcium from the sarcoplasmic reticulum
